text: In December of last year, Glassjaw announced the release of their original demos with producer Don Fury. Yesterday, March 7th, the demos made their debut on vinyl, which are available for purchase here. With no confirmation on whether or not the demos will be available on streaming platforms from Glassjaw, the vinyl may be the only way to hear the demos. Recorded back in 1998 before their debut record Everything You Ever Wanted to Know About Silence in 2000, the demos have sat untouched for 25 years. You can find the track list below. "Pretty Lush" "One Eight Becomes Two Zeros" "Ry Ry's Song" "Majour" "Motel Of White Lotus" "Matchbook Blackbook" "Harlem" "Train In Vain" Want More Metal? html:
In December of last year, Glassjaw announced the release of their original demos with producer Don Fury. Yesterday, March 7th, the demos made their debut on vinyl, which are available for purchase here.

With no confirmation on whether or not the demos will be available on streaming platforms from Glassjaw, the vinyl may be the only way to hear the demos.

Recorded back in 1998 before their debut record Everything You Ever Wanted to Know About Silence in 2000, the demos have sat untouched for 25 years.

You can find the track list below.

  1. "Pretty Lush"
  2. "One Eight Becomes Two Zeros"
  3. "Ry Ry's Song"
  4. "Majour"
  5. "Motel Of White Lotus"
  6. "Matchbook Blackbook"
  7. "Harlem"
  8. "Train In Vain"
